name: arrp-profile

datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

nkey.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: wifi

POST.summary:
Create object(s) in this table.
 Access Group: wifi

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: wifi

DELETE.summary:
Delete this specific resource.
 Access Group: wifi

help: Configure WiFi Automatic Radio Resource Provisioning (ARRP) profiles.

selection-period.name: selection-period
selection-period.help: Period in seconds to measure average channel load, noise floor, spectral RSSI (default = 3600).

monitor-period.name: monitor-period
monitor-period.help: Period in seconds to measure average transmit retries and receive errors (default = 300).

weight-managed-ap.name: weight-managed-ap
weight-managed-ap.help: Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for managed APs (0 - 2000, default = 50).

weight-rogue-ap.name: weight-rogue-ap
weight-rogue-ap.help: Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for rogue APs (0 - 2000, default = 10).

weight-noise-floor.name: weight-noise-floor
weight-noise-floor.help: Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for noise floor (0 - 2000, default = 40).

weight-channel-load.name: weight-channel-load
weight-channel-load.help: Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for channel load (0 - 2000, default = 20).

weight-spectral-rssi.name: weight-spectral-rssi
weight-spectral-rssi.help: Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for spectral RSSI (0 - 2000, default = 40).

weight-weather-channel.name: weight-weather-channel
weight-weather-channel.help: Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for weather channel (0 - 2000, default = 0).

weight-dfs-channel.name: weight-dfs-channel
weight-dfs-channel.help: Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for DFS channel (0 - 2000, default = 0).

threshold-ap.name: threshold-ap
threshold-ap.help: Threshold to reject channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 due to surrounding APs (0 - 500, default = 250).

threshold-noise-floor.name: threshold-noise-floor
threshold-noise-floor.help: Threshold in dBm to reject channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 due to noise floor (-95 to -20, default = -85).

threshold-channel-load.name: threshold-channel-load
threshold-channel-load.help: Threshold in percentage to reject channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 due to channel load (0 - 100, default = 60).

threshold-spectral-rssi.name: threshold-spectral-rssi
threshold-spectral-rssi.help: Threshold in dBm to reject channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 due to spectral RSSI (-95 to -20, default = -65).

threshold-tx-retries.name: threshold-tx-retries
threshold-tx-retries.help: Threshold in percentage for transmit retries to trigger channel reselection in DARRP monitor stage (0 - 1000, default = 300).

threshold-rx-errors.name: threshold-rx-errors
threshold-rx-errors.help: Threshold in percentage for receive errors to trigger channel reselection in DARRP monitor stage (0 - 100, default = 50).

include-weather-channel.name: include-weather-channel
include-weather-channel.help: Enable/disable use of weather channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 (default = enable).

options.name: enable
options.help: Include weather channel in darrp channel selection phase 1.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Include weather channel in darrp channel selection phase 1

options.name: disable
options.help: Exclude weather channel in darrp channel selection phase 1.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Exclude weather channel in darrp channel selection phase 1

include-dfs-channel.name: include-dfs-channel
include-dfs-channel.help: Enable/disable use of DFS channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 (default = enable).

options.name: enable
options.help: Include DFS channel in darrp channel selection phase 1.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Include DFS channel in darrp channel selection phase 1

options.name: disable
options.help: Exclude DFS channel in darrp channel selection phase 1.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Exclude DFS channel in darrp channel selection phase 1

override-darrp-optimize.name: override-darrp-optimize
override-darrp-optimize.help: Enable to override setting darrp-optimize and darrp-optimize-schedules (default = disable).

darrp-optimize.name: darrp-optimize
darrp-optimize.help: Time for running Distributed Automatic Radio Resource Provisioning (DARRP) optimizations (0 - 86400 sec, default = 86400, 0 = disable).

darrp-optimize-schedules.name: darrp-optimize-schedules
darrp-optimize-schedules.help: Firewall schedules for DARRP running time. DARRP will run periodically based on darrp-optimize within the schedules. Separate multiple schedule names with a space.
